item.title: AMD "GFX1250" To Double The Number Of User SGPRs
item.description: We still don't have much confirmed information on AMD's GFX1250 that has come to light in recent months due to being developed for their AMDGPU shader compiler back-end within LLVM. AMD GFX1250 surfaced in LLVM activity and the past few months has been seeing more additions made. A notable change committed today for LLVM is that the number of user Scalar General-Purpose Registers (SGPRs) has doubled...

item.description:

item.title: Hackers Unleash Devious Malware That Steals Crypto Wallet Data Via Fake Captcha: Report
item.description:
DNSFilter has reported fake captcha malware linked to Lumma Stealer, using copy-paste prompts on a Greek banking site and related domains. Crypto wallets have been targeted. Elliptic has said stolen funds have been laundered in minutes via DEXs, limiting recovery despite swift blocks

The post Hackers Unleash Devious Malware That Steals Crypto Wallet Data Via Fake Captcha: Report appeared first on Cryptonews.
